content.text:
# Timeline of Mustafa Kemal Atatürk__disambig_1

Timeline of Mustafa Kemal Atatürk is a timeline of events during the lifespan of Mustafa Kemal Atatürk. The timeline also includes the background events starting with the Sultan Abdul Hamid II.
{| class="wikitable"
|-
! colspan="4" | Legend
|-
| style="background:aqua;" | Military career
| style="background:lightsalmon;" | Leadership during Independence
| style="background:lime;" | Presidency
| style="background:yellow;" | Personal life
|}
{|class="wikitable"
|rowspan=2|1876
| 1 September
| Accession of Abdul Hamid II.
|-
| 23 December
| Promulgation of Ottoman constitution Ottoman constitution of 1876 (Kanûn-ı Esâsî).
|-
|rowspan=2|1877
| 19 March
| Opening of first Ottoman parliament.
|-
|24 April
|Russian troops enter Ottoman territory.
|-
|rowspan=3|1878
| 14 February
| Ottoman parliament dissolved.
|-
|3 March
| Russian victory confirmed by Treaty of San Stefano (Ayastefanos).
|-
| 13 July
| Treaty of Berlin replaces Treaty of San Stefano.
|-
| rowspan="2" |1881
| style="background:yellow;" |
| Mustafa (Kemal Atatürk) born in Salonica (Selanik, now Thessaloniki, Greece).
|-
| 24 May
| New border with Greece. Thessaly ceded to Greece.
|-
|1888
| style="background:yellow;" |
| Ali Rıza, Mustafa's father, dies.
|-
|1893
| style="background:aqua;" |
| Mustafa enters military preparatory school in Salonica.
|-
|1897
|
| Greco-Ottoman War.
|-
|1899
| style="background:aqua;" | 13 March
| Mustafa Kemal enters infantry class of War College in Constantinople (now known in English as Istanbul).
|-
|1902
| style="background:aqua;" | 10 February
| Commissioned Second Lieutenant, and enters Staff College.
|-
|1903
| style="background:aqua;" |
| Promoted First Lieutenant.
|-
|1905
| style="background:aqua;" | 11 January
| Passes out as Staff Captain and is posted for Fifth Army in Syria; revives a secret opposition group in Damascus.
|-
|1906
| style="background:aqua;" |
| Makes clandestine trip to Salonica.
|-
|rowspan=2|1907
| style="background:aqua;" | 20 June
| Promoted Adjutant-Major.
|-
| style="background:aqua;" | 13 October
| Posted to Third Army headquarters in Salonica.
|-
|rowspan=3|1908
| style="background:aqua;" | 22 June
| Appointed to Inspectorate of Eastern Railways in Rumelia.
|-
| 24 July
| Young Turk Revolution.
|-
| style="background:aqua;" | September
| Mustafa Kemal travels to Tripoli and Benghazi to re-establish CUP.
|-
|rowspan=3|1909
| style="background:aqua;" | 13 January
| Appointed chief of staff of 7th reserve division in Salonica.
|-
| style="background:aqua;" | 13 April
| Travels with his division to the outskirts of Constantinople; 31 March Incident.
|-
| 27 April
| Abdul Hamid II deposed and succeeded by Mehmet V; 31 March Incident.
|-
|1910
| style="background:aqua;" | September
| Visits French army manoeuvres in Picardy.
|-
|rowspan=5|1911
| style="background:aqua;" | 15 January
| Appointed to 5th army corps headquarters.
|-
| style="background:aqua;" | January
| Commander 38th infantry regiment.
|-
| style="background:aqua;" | 13 September
| Posted to general staff in Constantinople.
|-
| style="background:aqua;" | September
| Volunteers for service against the Italians in Cyrenaica.
|-
| style="background:aqua;" | 27 November
| Promoted Major.
|-
|rowspan=5|1912
| style="background:aqua;" | 11 March
| Appointed commander of Derne sector in Cyrenaica; Italo-Turkish War.
|-
| 8 October
| First Balkan War.
|-
| 8 October
| Salonica falls to the Greeks.
|-
| 24 October
| Mustafa Kemal leaves Cyrenaica and returns to Constantinople.
|-
| style="background:aqua;" | 25 November
| Appointed director of operations of Straits Composite Force.
|-
|rowspan=6|1913
| 23 January
| CUP seizes power (1913 Ottoman coup d'état).
|-
| 24 March
| Adrianople (Edirne) falls to the Bulgarians.
|-
| 29 June
| Second Balkan War.
|-
| 21 July
| Ottomans reoccupy Edirne.
|-
| 29 September
| Treaty of Constantinople fixes Turkish-Bulgarian frontier.
|-
| style="background:aqua;" | 27 October
| Mustafa Kemal appointed military attaché in Sofia.
|-
|rowspan=7|1914
| style="background:aqua;" | 1 March
| Mustafa Kemal promoted Lieutenant-Colonel.
|-
| 28 July
| Austria declares war on Serbia; beginning of First World War.
|-
| 2 August
| Ottoman Empire signs Ottoman–German alliance.
|-
| 29 October
| After Pursuit of Goeben and Breslau Ottoman navy under German command shells Russian targets.
|-
| 2 November
| Russia declares war on Ottoman Empire.
|-
| 5 November
| Britain declares war on Ottoman Empire.
|-
| 5 November
| France declares war on Ottoman Empire.
|-
|rowspan=4|1915
| style="background:aqua;" | 20 January
| Mustafa Kemal leaves Sofia to take up appointment as commander of 19th division for service in Battle of Gallipoli.
|-
| 21 March
| Allied navy fails to force the straits at Naval operations in the Dardanelles Campaign.
|-
| 27 April
| Allied troops Landing at Anzac Cove faced with Kemal.
|-
| style="background:aqua;" | 6 August
| Final attempts made by the British at Battle of Sari Bair faced with Kemal.
|-
|rowspan=4|1919
| style="background:lightsalmon;" |30 April
|Appointed the Inspector of the Ninth Army Troops.
|-
| style="background:lightsalmon;" |19 May
|Kemal lands in Samsun.
|-
| style="background:lightsalmon;" |8 July
|Mustafa Kemal resigns from the post of Inspector of Third Army and from the army.
|-
| style="background:lightsalmon;" |23 July
|Kemal elected Chairman of Erzurum Congress.
|-
|rowspan=2|1920
| style="background:lightsalmon;" |23 April
|Kemal opens the Grand National Assembly (BMM) in Angora (now Ankara).
|-
| style="background:lightsalmon;" |11 May
|Kemal is condemned to death by the government in Constantinople.
|-
|rowspan=3|1921
| style="background:lightsalmon;" |5 August
|Appointed Commander - in - Chief by the Grand National Assembly.
|-
| style="background:lightsalmon;" |23 August
|The battle of Sakarya begins with Turkish troops led by Mustafa Kemal.
|-
| style="background:lightsalmon;" |19 September
| Kemal receives the rank of Marshal and the title Gazi (veteran, victorious warrior).
|-
|rowspan=4|1922
| style="background:lightsalmon;" |26 August
|Gazi Mustafa Kemal begins to lead Great Offensive from the hill of Kocatepe.
|-
| style="background:lightsalmon;" |30 August
|Mustafa Kemal at the Battle of Dumlupınar.
|-
| style="background:lightsalmon;" |10 September
|Enters Izmir.
|-
| style="background:lightsalmon;" |1 November
|The Grand National Assembly abolish the Sultanate.
|-
|rowspan=4|1923
| style="background:yellow;" |14 January
|Zübeyde Hanım dies in Smyrna (now Izmir).
|-
| style="background:yellow;" |29 January
|Mustafa Kemal and Latife Uşşakizade marry in Izmir.
|-
| style="background:lightsalmon;" |29 October
|Proclamation of the Republic of Turkey.
|-
| style="background:lime;" |29 October
|Elected first president.
|-
|1928
| style="background:lime;" |9 August
|Speaks at Sarayburnu about the new Turkish alphabet.
|-
|1932
| style="background:lime;" |12 July
|Founds the Turkish Linguistic Society (now the Turkish Language Association).
|-
|1934
|16 June
|The Grand National Assembly of Turkey passes a law granting him the surname "ATATÜRK".
|-
|1938
| style="background:yellow;" |10 November
|He dies.
|}
See also
* Kemalist historiography
* Timeline of the Turkish War of Independence
* Timeline of Turkish history
* World War I timeline
References
